publication.abstract:
The presented ParaView plugin allows easy access to the algorithm described in Ref 1. It enables analysis of faceted objects that exhibit distortions in their digital representation, e.g. due to tomographic reconstruction artifacts.
The contributed functionality can also be used outside ParaView in e.g. command-line programs. The code, data, a test and an example program are included.

comments.content:
The current source can be found at:
http://gitlab.com/romangrothausmann/FacetAnalyser.git
http://github.com/romangrothausmann/FacetAnalyser.git

Docker images with the CLI and ParaView with the Plugin at:
http://gitlab.com/romangrothausmann/FacetAnalyser/container_registry

master branch for a local X without Nvidia graphics or vgl branch for Nvidia graphics (even without VGL):
git clone -b master http://gitlab.com/romangrothausmann/FacetAnalyser.git
cd FacetAnalyser/demo/
docker pull registry.gitlab.com/romangrothausmann/facetanalyser/master

CLI:
docker run -ti -v $(pwd):/tmp/fa --workdir=/tmp/fa/ \
 registry.gitlab.com/romangrothausmann/facetanalyser/master \
 FacetAnalyserCLI \
  8faced-rhombic-dodecahedron_twinned_010_deformed_wss.vtp \
  51 15 0.2 0.001 2 \
  8faced-rhombic-dodecahedron_twinned_010_deformed_wss_FA.vtp

PV:
../run.sh -dr --state=8faced-rhombic-dodecahedron_twinned_simp+def.pvsm

publication.title: Facet Analyser: ParaView plugin for automated facet detection and measurement of interplanar angles of tomographic objects
